pageContext.description: Edge fairly sharp, except the broken section in the centre. No trace of ribs on blade, but Ne flanges extend below the stop ridge towards the cutting edge,A slight hollow exists on each face of the blade, immediately below the stop ridge. Flanges well-cast and smooth; butt rather irregular.
pageContext.other: 2 cross section drawings of palstave on reverse.
pageContext.site: England, essex,chingford,found 30 august 1937 on e. side of relief channel near pickett's lock by c. cheffries, electrician. it was found protruding from ground which had been excavated most probably during construction of the relief channel, while making new metropolitan water board reservoir
